title: OMG, PS5 Horror Game Abandoned Is Mired In ...
text:
PS5 Horror Game Abandoned Sounds Like It's In Development Hell
The A.V. ClubDeadspinGizmodoJalopnikKotakuQuartzThe RootThe TakeoutThe OnionThe InventoryGaming Reviews, News, Tips and More.HomeLatestNewsGuidesReviewsThe BestsCultureOpinionAnimeEditionsEspañolDeutschFrançaisWe may earn a commission from links on this pageNewsOMG, PS5 Horror Game Abandoned Is Mired In Controversy Yet AgainApparently, Blue Box Game Studios founder Hasan Kahraman spends more time playing Rainbow Six Siege than working on his gameByLevi WinslowPublishedJune 7, 2022Comments (70)We may earn a commission from links on this page.Gif: Blue Box Game Studios / Sony / KotakuThe last time we heard about Abandoned, the PS5 exclusive that’s still shrouded in mystery, developer Blue Box Game Studios swore it wasn’t canceled despite reports suggesting otherwise. Well, it seems we’re back to questioning the game’s existence again after a GameSpot report alleged Abandoned’s development is in disarray and that there is no game at all.WatchTrek To Yomi Is The Best Time You’ll Never Want To Have Again
CCShare SubtitlesOffEnglishShare this VideoFacebookTwitterEmailRedditLinkview videoTrek To Yomi Is The Best Time You’ll Never Want To Have AgainThe Top Ten Most Played Games On Steam Deck: March 2023 EditionApril 7, 2023Comparing Resident Evil 4’s Chainsaw Demo To The Original GameMarch 15, 2023Abandoned has been mired in controversy since it was revealed almost a year ago. Originally suspected as a disguised Hideo Kojima project, Blue Box Game Studios was dragged for launching a barebones PS5 app with nothing in it but a brief teaser to a playable Prologue that still hasn’t materialized yet. The studio said that technical delays have disrupted its release timeline for the Prologue, but the fact that this demo of sorts hasn’t come out and the studio was quietly scrubbing its Twitter led some to wonder what’s going on. Turns out the game’s just “changing,” according to Blue Box Game Studios.AdvertisementRead More: Hyped PS5 Horror Game No One’s Really Seen Hasn’t Been Canceled, Dev SwearsAdvertisement“Changing” seems to be an understatement, though. In a GameSpot report in which the gaming outlet spoke to “more than half a dozen people who have had close contact with respect. Hasan never forced anyone to play games with him, and based on the chats shown, he always asked members.”The spokesperson disputed the “romantic” relationship claims against Kahraman, saying the archived messages were “more of a friendly chat.”Advertisement“The group ended in early April when one of the fans raged out of the group as they where told at some point to show a slice of the game,” the spokesperson said. “As a result of one of the members informing Hasan of that another member’s intention was to leak the slice, this demonstration never took place and Hasan stated this clearly. That is when the group started to end. Some angry members then reached out to GameSpot.”Still, none of this answers the real question: What the hell is going on? It’s been about a year since Abandoned was revealed and there’s been absolutely nothing to show for it. Not a new trailer or additional screenshots or anything. So if Blue Box Game Studios wants to silence nonbelievers, it should really consider peeling back the Abandoned curtain a little bit or just admit to everyone here and now that Abandoned has been…abandoned.AdvertisementKotaku has reached out to Sony for comment.Show all 70 commentsContinue reading

About This Game
The Abandoned is a short First Person Horror experience where you will solve puzzles and use your abilities to blast through waves of enemies while you uncover the story one chapter at a time.Chapter 1 : Awakening is included with this purchase of The Abandoned, with the remaining three chapters being released as DLC as they are developed. There are content updates and extra features being added on a regular basis during the evolution of the game.The player assumes the role of our main character, let's leave him unnamed for now. He is a young man, recently married, but still with a bit of a wild side. After a long weekend night out with a few friends he awakens to find himself on an old dirt path deep in some remote forest. After cursing his friends for dumping him out here, he realizes that the real problem is figuring out where here is and how to get back home. You will use your new found abilities to blast away waves of supernatural enemies while finding the clues to where you are and the means to get back home.You will look for keys and items to unlock new rooms in order to progress the story. There are plenty of options to customize your experience, including a darkness level and the ability to disable the enemies if that's your style. You can have a short enjoyable, atmospheric, escape room style game with the enemies turned off.GameplayFind keys and items to progress through the story chapter by chapter.Use magic abilities to defeat waves of enemies.Find hidden documents to unfold the entire story.Find hidden items that stay with you through your experience.Replay unlocked chapters to find missed items.FeaturesRealistic First Person perspective.Detailed 3D environments with Post-processing effects.Real-time 3D audio.
